title: Here's What Nawazuddin Siddiqui Has To Say About Nepotism In Bollywood
text:
facebook 
Earlier this year, Kangana Ranaut called Karan Johar the "flag-bearer of nepotism," on his own show, Koffee With Karan. This candid remark has stirred one of Bollywood's biggest scandals, and since the remark was made, many actors including Alia Bhatt, Aamir Khan, and Sonam Kapoor have shared their opinion about preferential treatment in the industry. 
The latest to have spoken on the matter is Nawazuddin Siddiqui, the supremely talented theatre artist without a famous last name or a godparent in Bollywood, who has earned his place among the who's who. His struggle has been real, and it was after years of hard work that he finally got the recognition he deserved. 
But, when it comes to nepotism, this is what he has to say, "I don't think nepotism exists in Bollywood. Otherwise, I could not have been in this position today. Good work and talent may take time to get recognised, but always earns respect." Picture Credits: Getty Images
